What's New with Woo
We recently debuted a useful new community resource: introducing the public WooCommerce Release Calendar!
This calendar provides a centralized hub for up-to-date information on our release schedule, testing periods, freeze dates, and more - so you can plan your work in advance and be the first to know about upcoming changes.
Add the calendar

New in our Marketplace

Say goodbye to tax woes
From rates to reports to returns, dealing with taxes can be a headache. Say goodbye to tax woes with Stripe Tax.
Stripe Tax automatically applies the correct sales tax, VAT, or GST, saving time while keeping stores cool and compliant. And with simple automatic filing, clients can stop stressing and focus on growth.
Automate my taxes
Automate my taxes

Translate stores for the global market
Help clients boost sales and appeal to new audiences with a multilingual Woo store.
Weglot Translate provides seamless, high-quality translations in 110+ languages - making it simple to increase reach, improve customer experience, and drive global sales, all in a few clicks.
Translate today
Translate today

New in WooCommerce 9.4
  • WooCommerce 9.4 is scheduled to be released Monday, November 11, 2024.This new version is packed with updates, from remote error logging to a smarter product collection block and improved search inside WooCommerce. See what's new.
  • Starting with 9.4, the functionality of the WooCommerce Brands extension will also become part of WooCommerce core. You'll be able to create dedicated brand pages, show brand details on product pages, and enable brand-specific site navigation.

Bite-sized updates
  • To improve stability and allow more thorough testing, our release cycle is now five (5) weeks long, with releases now scheduled for Mondays.
  • Meet Blaze, the advertising platform designed to promote products across Tumblr and WordPress.com. Whether you're a beginner or a pro, setting up ad campaigns is fast and simple every time. Clients don't need a large budget to get noticed by the right customers, either. It's time to turn up the heat - help them grow with Blaze today.

Run your store from anywhere

This email was sent to support@wolfiq.com.au. You're receiving it because you opted in when creating an account, submitting a form, or checking out on WooCommerce.com.

No longer want to receive these emails? Update your preferences or unsubscribe. You may still receive transactional and/or account-related emails from WooCommerce.com.

WooCommerce, Inc. is located at 60 29th St #343, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA.

View an online version of this email.
